catalogue_raissonne: A. Robaut, L'oeuvre de Corot, Catalogue raisonne et illustre, Paris, 1902, vol. 2, no. 77, p. 32, as "Rome-Vue Prise du Monte Pincio."
creditline: Gift of a member of the Hill family in celebration of the MIA's 100th anniversary
medium: Oil on paper mounted on canvas
text: Corot is universally regarded as the most influential artist of the Barbizon school, and this oil sketch is a beautiful example of his genius as a landscape painter. Seven of the Corot paintings in the museum’s collection were gifts from the Hill family - View of St. Peter’s, Rome now makes eight.
title: View of Rome from Monte Pincio
